page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: SMUGGLING Around Porthleven there used to be a lot of smuggling. The Ship Inn used to be a favourite meeting place for smugglers. From one of the caves on the beach there is a secret passage which comes up under the floor boards at Methleigh Farm which is about a mile in land. MINING Around Porthleven there was a lot of lead and silver mining. One of the roads called Wheal Rose is named after a mine. The miners used to get their pay at a house on Breageside. HARBOUR The Harbour, originally built by Harveys, used to be used for importing cargoes of coal, limestone, timber, salt and cement. Over 10,000 tons of coal was imported in 1870.
